contentrichtext.text: {{unreferenced|date=July 2008}} {{Infobox Paris metro |Name=Mairie d'Issy |Pic=[[File:Paris metro - Mairie d'Issy - 1.JPG|275px]] |Day=24 March |Year=1934 |Access= |Municipality=Issy-les-Moulineaux |Zone=2 |Next= {{Paris Metro/next special|12|Terminus|[[Corentin Celton (Paris Metro)|Corentin Celton]] }} | X=57 | Y=139 }} '''Mairie d'Issy''' is a [[metro station|station]] on [[Paris Métro Line 12|line 12]] of the [[Paris Métro]] in the [[French communes|commune]] of [[Issy-les-Moulineaux]]. It is near Issy-les-Moulineaux town hall and the shops located in ''Avenue Victor Cresson'' and ''Avenue de la République''. The station opened on 24 March 1934 as part of extension of the line from [[Porte de Versailles (Paris Métro)|Porte de Versailles]]. ==Gallery== <gallery widths="200px" heights="125px" perrow="2"> File:Metro - Paris - Ligne 12 - Mairie d Issy.jpg|[[Paris Métro Line 12|Line 12]] platforms at Mairie d'Issy File:Paris metro - Mairie d'Issy - 2.JPG|[[MF 67]] rolling stock on Line 12 at Mairie d'Issy </gallery> {{commons category|Mairie d'Issy (Paris Metro)}} ==References== *Roland, Gérard (2003). ''Stations de métro. D’Abbesses à Wagram.'' Éditions Bonneton. {{Paris Metro/line 12}} {{coord|48.824152|N|2.273434|E|region:FR_type:landmark_scale:2000_source:frwiki|display=title|format=dms}} [[Category:Railway stations opened in 1934]] {{Paris-metro-stub}}
